history.content:
120/400 is exactly 30% of the class size, so perhaps a rounding error in combination with the listed policy?

If the above is the case then why can't I sign up for CS 188 either, when there are 145 open seats out of a capacity of 420?
120/400 is exactly 30% of the class size, so perhaps a rounding error in combination with the listed policy?

children.subject: I am having this same problem with CS 170 and also with CS 188. I am also an incoming EECS junior.

history.content:
170: From the reporting system I can tell that there were 280 seats in the course for EECS or CS students. These have all filled, with a waitlist of 53. There are 120 other seats that will be made available (and students enrolled off the waitlist starting with cs/eecs majors who used phase 1 or phase 2 to waitlist) once sufficient additional TAs have been hired.

188: Same situation with 275 seats saved for EECS/CS students. These are all filled with 48 on the waitlist. 145 seats saved for if/when sufficient TAs have been hired.

Initial enrollments for upper div cs seats are always blocked at 70% of projected enrollment unless and until sufficient (U)GSI hiring is complete to support that larger # of students.

170: Michael-David will have more info, but from the reporting system I can tell that there were 280 seats in the course for EECS or CS students. These have all filled, with a waitlist of 53. There are 120 other seats, saved for permission numbers. These may be released once funding is secured for additional TAs, or some other issue is resolved, however I would assume that this isn't guaranteed. 

188: Same situation with 275 seats saved for EECS/CS students. These are all filled with 48 on the waitlist. 145 seats saved for folks with permission numbers.

170: Michael-David will have more info, but from the reporting system I can tell that there were 280 seats in the course for EECS or CS students. These have all filled, with a waitlist of 53. There are 120 other seats, saved for permission numbers. These may be released once funding is secured for additional TAs, or some other issue is resolved, however I would assume that this isn't guaranteed. 

188: Same situation with 275 seats saved for EECS/CS students. These are all filled with 48 on the waitlist. 145 seats saved for folks with permission numbers. 

I'm surprised that you're just enrolling in courses now, was your hold only just removed?

children.subject: I am also having the same issue for CS 170.

CS188: 145 seats open but placed on waitlist

I'm an EECS undergrad and was placed as number 50-something on the waitlist. Does anyone know why this occurred even though schedule planner reports 145 open seats?

Well, anyone who isn't a declared CS/EECS major has to be on the waitlist right now. (I'm assuming that the non-senior majors who had to waitlist in Phase I already got processed.)

The number of open seats is larger than the number of people on the waitlist, so I don't think the fact that there is a waitlist is particularly relevant.

Alternatively, I see no reason to think that the class will expand either.

Are there going to be more seats opening up for CS 170?

Phase 2 started today, and already there is a waitlist. Am I better off just trying to enroll in another upper-div?

Chances of getting into 170

I am a rising sophomore EECS student who chose to use Phase 1 for CS 188 and a breadth course, under the assumption that it would be possible to get into CS 170 in Phase 2. But now, it looks like all the seats for EECS students are already taken up.

My Phase 2 is on August 2nd. What are my chances of getting into 170?

To avoid the classic I-solved-my-problem-but-am-going-to-say-resolved-without-helping-anybody-else Piazza problem: you need to delete the course, then find the course again, add it to your cart (making sure you tick the "waitlist if class is full" checkbox) while you're clicking through, then enroll.

Honestly fuck this bullshit broken system overall, it's a ridiculous hassle. There's also a problem that it thinks the 16 unit phase II soft cap is a hard cap. Unbelievable.
I think the policy is now that it is a 16 unit hard cap. http://sis.berkeley.edu/student/enrollment

So I'm trying to enroll into 162 right now, and it's giving me the same error. Since I can't waitlist, does that mean the waitlist is full? How do I "wait" for a permission number? I'm a declared CS Senior

history.content: Hi, I am an incoming EECS junior, and I am unable to enroll in CS170. It says, "You are unable to enroll in this class at this time. Available seats are reserved and you do not meet the reserve capacity requirements. If a wait list is available, you may still be placed on the waitlist for this class. To do this, select Add Another Class to return to step 1. Select the class link, select the wait list option and resubmit your request." Why is that? There are 119 spots still available in the class, and the discussion session I selected is also open.
history.subject: Can't enroll in CS170
